intro: Sisyrinchium demissum var. amethystinum, commonly known as the amethyst blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a striking visual element to its habitat. The variety is distinguished by its more intense violet hue compared to the typical form of Sisyrinchium demissum.
